content: A long-term “identity” truth perhaps, but I’ve been top-performer many times doing something I didn’t love doing at all, but was simply good at (e.g. cold call sales and closing–I give great phone). However I never identified myself as being of that tribe, it was just something to pay the bills until a better opportunity came along. Perhaps we should refine this statement to saying “do what you love most within your tribe” for the advice to have the most applicable power?
